text.p: BLANTYRE, Oct 23 (Reuter) These are the leading stories in the Malawi press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Straight Talk, a safe sex, Aids awareness, drug and alcohol control radio programme for the youth is threatened with a ban at the country's only state run radio, Malawi Broadcasting Corporation (MBC), for using language against the radio's policy.

- Government said it is taking seriously threats that some members of the opposition Alliance for Democracy (AFORD) will bring a Rwanda type of bloodshed to the country if their enstranged member of parliament, busines tycoon Chenda Mkandawire, was allowed to speak at presidential rallies.
- One of the big political parties is buying off voter registration cards in the run up to the by-elections to be held on November 19 in Blantyre city.

- Prices of medicinal drugs will soon drop after a special committee set to probe drug pricing and sourcing said it would likely recommend government drop a 20 per cent surtax and 10 per cent customs duty on imported drugs.

- The National Compensation Tribunal, a tribunal set to compensate victims of former President Kamuzu Banda's 30-year-old dictatorship, has run out of funds and it is not known when it will be replenished.
